title: 111_hr4147
content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. A qualified airline employee can rollover airline payment amounts to a traditional IRA within 180 days of receipt, treating it as a rollover contribution. The transferred amount can be excluded from gross income in the year it was received. Amounts attributable to the airline payment can be transferred to a Roth IRA after the rollover. A qualified airline employee who rolled over an airline payment amount to a Roth IRA can transfer it to a traditional IRA within 180 days. This transfer will be considered to have been made at the time of the rollover to the Roth IRA. The employee can exclude the rolled-over amount from gross income if transferred to a traditional IRA in the same taxable year. For employment tax purposes, an airline payment amount to a qualified airline employee is considered wages by the airline carrier, even if excluded from the employee's gross income. Qualified employees can file a refund claim within the specified time limit. For employment tax purposes, an airline payment amount to a qualified airline employee is considered wages by the airline carrier, even if excluded from the employee's gross income. This applies to payments approved by a Federal bankruptcy court between September 11, 2001, and January 1, 2007, related to the employee's interest in a bankruptcy claim against the carrier. The airline payment amount to a qualified airline employee is considered wages by the carrier, excluding future earnings or profits. The employee must have been a participant in a defined benefit plan maintained by the carrier. A traditional IRA is an individual retirement plan that is not a Roth IRA, as defined by the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. A Roth IRA is defined by section 408A(b) of the same Code. If a qualified airline employee dies after receiving an airline payment amount, or if the payment is made to their surviving spouse, specific conditions apply. The surviving spouse of a qualified airline employee can take actions permitted under section 125 of the Worker, Retiree and Employer Recovery Act of 2008, or under this section, to the same extent as the employee could have done. This section applies to transfers made after the enactment of the Act with respect to airline payment amounts paid before, on, or after such date.
